creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: small round bowl with inward curving walls; subtly lobed; darker green celadon glaze
text: Aoki Mokubei, a potter, painter, and scholar, probably made this small bowl, which used to hold water for washing one’s calligraphy and paint brushes. Mokubei’s porcelain works tend to relate to scholarly pursuits, Chinese learning, and sencha or steeped-tea ceremony.
title: Lobed Celadon Brush Washer
